title: Charles Young Buffalo Soldiers National Monument: Guided Tours
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Guided Tours              Guided Tours         A park ranger speaks with visitors during a tour of "Youngsholm," the former residence of Col. Charles Young and family. NPS / Tom Engberg  Open House Dates Dates & Times: TBA Location: "Youngsholm"  Fees: None   Please check back regularly or stay informed via our Social Media pages for announcements on future open house dates.  If you or your group would like to schedule a time to visit the park, please Contact Us by phone or email.   While the park will make every effort to ensure the availability of the house to be open on the listed days, dates and times are subject to change and/or cancellation.  Any changes to tour dates/times will be posted on the park's website and Social Media pages.     "Youngsholm" is located at 1120 U.S. Route 42 East, approximately 3 miles east of Xenia and less than 1 mile west of Wilberforce and Central State Universities.  Visit the Directions page for a map and directions to the park.   Charles Young purchased the house located at 1120 U.S. Route 42 East, with his wife Ada in 1907 and affectionately nicknamed it "Youngsholm."  The house would become the social hub of the Wilberforce University area for many years as notable African Americans, family, friends and strangers would often gather there to enjoy the Young family hospitality.
